Regression Cost Calculations

Source: vignettes/regression_cost_calcs.Rmd
regression_cost_calcs.Rmd

The purpose of this vignette is to present the calculations for a peicewise linear regression where for each time step there are multiple independent observations.

In the follow variables identified by Greek letters are considered unknown.

Linear regression

At time step tt the vector of iid observations ğ²t={yt,1,â€¦,yt,p}\mathbf{y}_{t}=\left\{y_{t,1},\ldots,y_{t,p}\right\} is explained by the design matrix ğ—t\mathbf{X}_{t} and modelled as a multivariate Gaussian distribution. Consider known, â€˜â€™backgroundâ€™â€™, parameters ğ¦t\mathbf{m}_{t} and precision matrix ğ’t=ğ”â€²ğ”\mathbf{S}_{t} = \mathbf{U}^{\prime}\mathbf{U} deviation from which are modelled by Î¸\theta and Î›\Lambda through the likelihood

L(ğ²t|Î¸,Î»)=(2Ï€)âˆ’p/2det(ğ’t)1/2det(Î›)1/2exp(âˆ’12(ğ²tâˆ’ğ—tğ¦tâˆ’ğ—tÎ¸)â€²ğ”â€²Î›ğ”(ğ²tâˆ’ğ—tğ¦tâˆ’ğ—tÎ¸)) L\left(\mathbf{y}_{t} \left| \theta,\lambda\right.\right) = \left(2\pi\right)^{-p/2} \det\left(\mathbf{S}_{t}\right)^{1/2} \det\left(\Lambda\right)^{1/2} \exp\left(-\frac{1}{2}\left( \mathbf{y}_{t} - \mathbf{X}_{t} \mathbf{m}_{t} - \mathbf{X}_{t} \theta\right)^{\prime} \mathbf{U}^{\prime} \Lambda \mathbf{U} \left( \mathbf{y}_{t} - \mathbf{X}_{t} \mathbf{m}_{t} - \mathbf{X}_{t} \theta\right) \right)

Pre whitening the known values such that ğ²Ì‚t=ğ”t(ğ²tâˆ’ğ—tğ¦t)\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} = \mathbf{U}_{t} \left(\mathbf{y}_{t} - \mathbf{X}_{t} \mathbf{m}_{t}\right) and ğ—Ì‚t=ğ”tğ—t\hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} = \mathbf{U}_{t} \mathbf{X}_{t} gives

L(ğ²t|Î¸,Î›)=(2Ï€)âˆ’p/2det(ğ’t)1/2det(Î›)1/2exp(âˆ’12(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸)â€²Î›(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸)) L\left(\mathbf{y}_{t} \left| \theta,\Lambda\right.\right) = \left(2\pi\right)^{-p/2} \det\left(\mathbf{S}_{t}\right)^{1/2} \det\left(\Lambda\right)^{1/2} \exp\left(-\frac{1}{2}\left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta\right)^{\prime} \Lambda \left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta\right) \right)

Grouping the known values into Kt=plog(2Ï€)âˆ’log(detğ’t)K_{t} = p\log\left(2\pi\right) - \log\left(\det{\mathbf{S}_{t}}\right) the log likelihood is l(ğ²t|Î¸,Î›)=âˆ’12Kt+12log(det(Î›))âˆ’12(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸)â€²Î›(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸) l\left(\mathbf{y}_{t} \left| \theta,\Lambda \right.\right) = -\frac{1}{2}K_{t} + \frac{1}{2}\log\left( \det\left(\Lambda\right)\right) -\frac{1}{2}\left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta\right)^{\prime} \Lambda \left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta\right)

Suppose an anomaly with common parameters occurs of nkn_{k} consecuative time steps in the set TkT_{k}. The log-likelihood of ğ²tâˆˆTk\mathbf{y}_{t \in T_{k}} is l(ğ²tâˆˆTk|Î¸k,Î›k)=âˆ’12âˆ‘tâˆˆTkKt+nk2log(det(Î›))âˆ’12âˆ‘tâˆˆTk(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸k)â€²Î›k(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸k) l\left(\mathbf{y}_{t \in T_{k}} \left| \theta_{k},\Lambda_{k} \right.\right) = -\frac{1}{2}\sum_{t \in T_{k}}K_{t} + \frac{n_{k}}{2}\log\left( \det\left(\Lambda\right)\right) -\frac{1}{2}\sum_{t \in T_{k}}\left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta_{k}\right)^{\prime} \Lambda_{k} \left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta_{k}\right)

with the cost being twice the negative log likelihood plus a penalty Î²\beta giving

C(ğ²tâˆˆTk|Î¸k,Î›k)=âˆ‘tâˆˆTkKtâˆ’nklog(det(Î›))+âˆ‘tâˆˆTk(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸k)â€²Î›k(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸k)+Î² C\left(\mathbf{y}_{t \in T_{k}} \left| \theta_{k}, \Lambda_{k} \right.\right) = \sum_{t \in T_{k}}K_{t} - n_{k}\log\left( \det\left(\Lambda\right)\right) +\sum_{t \in T_{k}}\left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta_{k}\right)^{\prime} \Lambda_{k} \left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta_{k}\right) + \beta

Sufficent statistics

Computation is greatly aided by being able to keep adequate sufficent statistics. Expanding the summation in the cost gives âˆ‘tâˆˆTk(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸k)â€²Î›k(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸k)=âˆ‘tâˆˆTk(ğ²Ì‚tâ€²Î›ğ²Ì‚t+Î¸kâ€²ğ—Ì‚tâ€²Î›ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸kâˆ’2Î¸kâ€²ğ—Ì‚tâ€²Î›ğ²Ì‚t) \sum_{t \in T_{k}}\left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta_{k}\right)^{\prime} \Lambda_{k} \left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta_{k}\right) = \sum_{t \in T_{k}} \left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}^{\prime}_{t} \Lambda \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} + \theta^{\prime}_{k}\hat{\mathbf{X}}^{\prime}_{t} \Lambda \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta_{k} - 2 \theta^{\prime}_{k} \hat{\mathbf{X}}^{\prime}_{t}\Lambda \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right) âˆ‘tâˆˆTk(tr(ğ²Ì‚tğ²Ì‚tâ€²Î›)+Î¸kâ€²ğ—Ì‚tâ€²Î›ğ—Ì‚tÎ¸kâˆ’2Î¸kâ€²ğ—Ì‚tâ€²Î›ğ²Ì‚t) \sum_{t \in T_{k}} \left( \mathrm{tr}\left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}\hat{\mathbf{y}}^{\prime}_{t} \Lambda \right) + \theta^{\prime}_{k}\hat{\mathbf{X}}^{\prime}_{t} \Lambda \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \theta_{k} - 2 \theta^{\prime}_{k} \hat{\mathbf{X}}^{\prime}_{t}\Lambda \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right)

Baseline: No Anomaly

Here Î¸k=ğŸ\theta_{k}=\mathbf{0}, Î›k\Lambda_{k} is an identify matrix and there is no penalty so Î²=0\beta = 0. The resulting csot is CB(ğ²tâˆˆTk|Î¸k,Î›k)=âˆ‘tâˆˆTkKt+âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ²Ì‚tâ€²ğ²Ì‚t C_{B}\left(\mathbf{y}_{t \in T_{k}} \left| \theta_{k}, \Lambda_{k} \right.\right) = \sum_{t \in T_{k}} K_{t} + \sum_{t \in T_{k}} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}^{\prime} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}

Collective Anomalies

Anomaly in Regression parameters

There is no change in variance so Î›k\Lambda_{k} is an identify matrix. The estimate Î¸Ì‚k\hat{\theta}_{k} of Î¸k\theta_{k} can be selected to minimise the cost by taking

Î¸Ì‚k=(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—Ì‚tâ€²ğ—Ì‚t)âˆ’1(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—Ì‚tâ€²ğ²Ì‚t) \hat{\theta}_{k} = \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t}^{\prime} \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t} \right)^{-1} \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \hat{\mathbf{X}}_{t}^{\prime} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right)

CC(ğ²tâˆˆTk|Î¼t,mk,Ïƒk,sk)=âˆ‘tâˆˆTkKt+(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ²Ì‚tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t)âˆ’(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t)â€²(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ—t)âˆ’1(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t)+Î² C_{C}\left(\mathbf{y}_{t \in T_{k}} \left| \mu_t,m_k,\sigma_k,s_k\right.\right) = \sum_{t \in T_{k}} K_{t} + \left( \sum_{t \in T_{k}} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right) - \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right)^{\prime} \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\mathbf{X}_{t} \right)^{-1} \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right) +\beta

Anomaly in Variance

These is no mean anomaly in the regression parameters so Î¸k=0\theta_{k}=0. The estimate of Ïƒk\sigma_{k} therfore changes to

ÏƒÌ‚k=1nkâˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ²Ì‚tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t \hat{\sigma}_{k} = \frac{1}{n_{k}} \sum\limits_{t \in T_{k}} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}

while the cost is CC(ğ²tâˆˆTk|Î¼t,mk,Ïƒk,sk)=âˆ‘tâˆˆTkKt+nklog(ÏƒÌ‚k)+nk+Î² C_{C}\left(\mathbf{y}_{t \in T_{k}} \left| \mu_t,m_k,\sigma_k,s_k\right.\right) = \sum_{t \in T_{k}} K_{t} +n_{k} \log\left(\hat{\sigma}_{k}\right) +n_{k} +\beta

Anomaly in regression parameters and variance

Since âˆ‘tâˆˆTk(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—tÎ¸k)â€²ğ’tâˆ’1(ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’ğ—tÎ¸k)=âˆ‘tâˆˆTk(ğ²Ì‚tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’2Î¸kâ€²ğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t+Î¸kâ€²ğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ—tÎ¸k) \sum_{t \in T_{k}} \left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \mathbf{X}_{t} \theta_{k}\right)^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1} \left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - \mathbf{X}_{t} \theta_{k}\right) = \sum_{t \in T_{k}} \left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - 2 \theta_{k}^{\prime}\mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} + \theta_{k}^{\prime}\mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\mathbf{X}_{t} \theta_{k} \right)

The estimate Î¸Ì‚k\hat{\theta}_{k} of Î¸k\theta_{k} can be selected to minimise the cost by taking Î¸Ì‚k=(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ—t)âˆ’1(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t) \hat{\theta}_{k} = \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\mathbf{X}_{t} \right)^{-1} \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right)

Subsitution of this result into the cost gives ÏƒÌ‚k=1nkâˆ‘tâˆˆTk(ğ²Ì‚tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚tâˆ’2Î¸Ì‚kâ€²ğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t+Î¸Ì‚kâ€²ğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ—tÎ¸Ì‚k) \hat{\sigma}_{k} = \frac{1}{n_{k}} \sum_{t \in T_{k}} \left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} - 2 \hat{\theta}_{k}^{\prime}\mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} + \hat{\theta}_{k}^{\prime}\mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\mathbf{X}_{t} \hat{\theta}_{k} \right) which simplifies to ÏƒÌ‚k=1nk[(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ²Ì‚tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t)âˆ’(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t)â€²(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ—t)âˆ’1(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t)] \hat{\sigma}_{k} = \frac{1}{n_{k}} \left[ \left( \sum_{t \in T_{k}} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right) - \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right)^{\prime} \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\mathbf{X}_{t} \right)^{-1} \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right) \right]

The cost is given by CC(ğ²tâˆˆTk|Î¼t,mk,Ïƒk,sk)=âˆ‘tâˆˆTkKt+nklog(ÏƒÌ‚k)+nk+Î² C_{C}\left(\mathbf{y}_{t \in T_{k}} \left| \mu_t,m_k,\sigma_k,s_k\right.\right) = \sum_{t \in T_{k}} K_{t} +n_{k} \log\left(\hat{\sigma}_{k}\right) +n_{k} +\beta

Anomaly in Regression parameters

There is no change in variance so Ïƒk=1\sigma_{k}=1. The estimate of Î¸Ì‚k\hat{\theta}_{k} is unchanged which gives a cost of

CC(ğ²tâˆˆTk|Î¼t,mk,Ïƒk,sk)=âˆ‘tâˆˆTkKt+(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ²Ì‚tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t)âˆ’(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t)â€²(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ—t)âˆ’1(âˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ—tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t)+Î² C_{C}\left(\mathbf{y}_{t \in T_{k}} \left| \mu_t,m_k,\sigma_k,s_k\right.\right) = \sum_{t \in T_{k}} K_{t} + \left( \sum_{t \in T_{k}} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right) - \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right)^{\prime} \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\mathbf{X}_{t} \right)^{-1} \left( \sum\limits_{t \in T_k} \mathbf{X}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right) +\beta

Anomaly in Variance

These is no mean anomaly in the regression parameters so Î¸k=0\theta_{k}=0. The estimate of Ïƒk\sigma_{k} therfore changes to

ÏƒÌ‚k=1nkâˆ‘tâˆˆTkğ²Ì‚tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t \hat{\sigma}_{k} = \frac{1}{n_{k}} \sum\limits_{t \in T_{k}} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}

while the cost is CC(ğ²tâˆˆTk|Î¼t,mk,Ïƒk,sk)=âˆ‘tâˆˆTkKt+nklog(ÏƒÌ‚k)+nk+Î² C_{C}\left(\mathbf{y}_{t \in T_{k}} \left| \mu_t,m_k,\sigma_k,s_k\right.\right) = \sum_{t \in T_{k}} K_{t} +n_{k} \log\left(\hat{\sigma}_{k}\right) +n_{k} +\beta

Point anomaly

A point anomaly occurs at a single time instance and is represented as a variance anomaly. Naively the cost could be computed using the formulea for a variance anomaly as Cp(ğ²t|Ïƒt)=Kt+ntlog(ÏƒÌ‚t)+nt+Î² C_{p}\left(\mathbf{y}_{t}\left| \sigma_{t}\right.\right) = K_{t} + n_{t} \log\left( \hat{\sigma}_{t} \right) + n_{t} + \beta with ÏƒÌ‚t=1ntğ²Ì‚tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t \hat{\sigma}_{t} = \frac{1}{n_{t}} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}

Relating this to the background cost we see that point anomalies may be accepted in the capa search when f(ÏƒÌ‚t,Î³,Î²)=Cp(yt|Î¼t,Ïƒt)âˆ’CB(yt|Î¼t,Ïƒt)=ntlog(ÏƒÌ‚t)+nt+Î²âˆ’ntÏƒÌ‚t<0 f\left(\hat{\sigma}_{t},\gamma,\beta\right) = C_{p}\left(y_{t}\left| \mu_{t},\sigma_{t}\right.\right) - C_{B}\left(y_{t}\left| \mu_{t},\sigma_{t}\right.\right) = n_{t} \log \left( \hat{\sigma}_{t} \right) + n_{t} + \beta - n_{t} \hat{\sigma}_{t} < 0

The following plot shows log(ÏƒÌ‚t)+1âˆ’ÏƒÌ‚t\log \left( \hat{\sigma}_{t} \right) + 1 - \hat{\sigma}_{t} which indicates that point anomalies may be declared for both outlying and inlying data.

In the case of nt=1n_{t}=1 Fisch et al.Â control this by modifying the cost of a point anomaly so it is expressed as Cp(yt|Ïƒt,ğ—t)=log(exp(âˆ’Î²)+ÏƒÌ‚t)+Kt+1+Î² C_{p}\left(y_{t}\left| \sigma_{t}, \mathbf{X}_{t}\right.\right) = \log\left(\exp\left(-\beta\right) + \hat{\sigma}_{t} \right) + K_{t} + 1 + \beta

This has the effect of allowing only outlier anomalies, something that can be much more easily acheived by taking

ÏƒÌ‚t=max(1,1ntğ²Ì‚tâ€²ğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t) \hat{\sigma}_{t} = \max\left(1,\frac{1}{n_{t}} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}^{\prime} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1}\hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t}\right)

giving the cost as

C(ğ²tâˆˆTk|Î¼t,mk,Ïƒk,sk)=âˆ‘tâˆˆTkKt+nklog(ÏƒÌ‚k)+1ÏƒÌ‚kâˆ‘tâˆˆTk(ğ²Ì‚tğ’tâˆ’1ğ²Ì‚t)+Î² C\left(\mathbf{y}_{t \in T_{k}} \left| \mu_t,m_k,\sigma_k,s_k\right.\right) = \sum_{t \in T_{k}} K_{t} +n_{k} \log\left(\hat{\sigma}_{k}\right) +\frac{1}{\hat{\sigma}_{k}}\sum_{t \in T_{k}} \left( \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \mathbf{S}_{t}^{-1} \hat{\mathbf{y}}_{t} \right) +\beta
